Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Exude \Ex*ude"\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Exuded}; p. pr. & vb. n. {exuding}.] [L. exudare, exsudare, exudatum, exsudatum, to sweat out; ex out + sudare to sweat: cf. F. exuder, exsuder. See {Sweat}.] To discharge through pores or incisions, as moisture or other liquid matter; to give out. [1913 Webster]
Our forests exude turpentine in . . . abundance. --Dr. T. Dwight. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Exude \Ex*ude"\, v. i. To flow from a body through the pores, or by a natural discharge, as juice. [1913 Webster]

exude v 1: release (a liquid) in drops or small quantities; "exude sweat through the pores" [syn: {exudate}, {transude}, {ooze out}, {ooze}] 2: make apparent by one's mood or behaviour; "She exude great confidence"
